entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to Goliards, wandering medieval students who earned money by singing and reciting poetry.
examples: Minstrels and goliardic clerics - priests, monks and university students who dropped out, travelled all over Europe and composed loose or satirical works - had been and continued to be the creators of fabliaux and interludes.

entries.meaning: Of or pertaining to a form of medieval lyric poetry that typically celebrated licentiousness and drinking.
examples: The concept of goliardic poetry rests on a series of stylistic traits and the identification of the corpus with the figure of the wandering goliard.
